content.content: One edit means remove/add/change 1 character.\n\nA tip: the problem asks if they are EXACTLY one edit distance apart
if s == "" and t == "", why the expected answer is false? Empty strings should be equal.
[@shrined](/shrined) ya but it sounds like WITHIN 1 edit distance so a would think it means <= 1 edit_distance
The question is titled "One edit distance" not "Zero edit distance" :P.
One of the purposes of this question is to check how many people will get trapped into going the dynamic programming way :)
true

I think the problem should mention that inputs like "ab" and "bca" are NOT one distance apart, to make sure we don't make wrong assumptions, I took a while to figure this out, in a real interview I'd have asked that.
Did anyone else get really mad when they realized that equal string\'s aren\'t considered within 1 edit distance apart lmao.
edge cases
